editorial_summary.overview: Family-friendly exhibits with a variety of sea creatures (most offer play areas & group packages).

reviews.text:
Really enjoyed the visit with our 1 year old! She loved seeing all the colours and fish throughout the aquarium. It was well laid out and you could clearly see everything.

Would take you about two hours to go through the entire thing properly, but there are sections you can skip if you‚Äôre not interested.

There was wheelchair and pushchair access throughout the aquarium so it made it easy to navigate.

I recently visited Sea Life London, and I was truly captivated by the mesmerizing underwater world they have created. The diverse marine life on display is not only breathtaking but also educational. From the vibrant coral reefs to the graceful sea turtles, every exhibit is a feast for the eyes. The knowledgeable staff were passionate and eager to share their expertise, making the experience even more enriching. It's a fantastic place for families, couples, or anyone looking to escape into the enchanting world of the ocean. I left with a newfound appreciation for our planet's aquatic wonders. Sea Life London is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a memorable and educational adventure.

We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The tanks were set up really well. The layout is well done allowing you to see into some of the same tanks from multiple angles and levels. The shark tank was massive and seemed to be a huge draw to everyone. The jellyfish zone was really neat and the tank lighting helped you see their details. I could go on... but if you haven't been, I highly recommend it!

We had a great time watching a variety of fish, penguins, poisonous green snakes üòçüëç at the sea life in London. Sea Life is
next to the London Eye. You can go to Shriekh Adventure & London Dungeon too so please keep track of your time when purchasing tickets as it takes one & half hours minimum time to visit these places.
When you enter see life you get to see sharks moving underneath as it has a glass floor a great experience. A variety of shark tanks are there. Children love this place as it is crowded with kids. Inside restrooms are there too. The jellyfish tank changes colours it looks so beautiful üëå. Variety of live corals a treat for eyes. Another great attraction is the penguins they walk, they play around just making their video I felt so happy ‚ù§Ô∏è. You get snacks inside sea life too.
To reach sea life one can take an underground metro by crossing the  Westminster Bridge. So I will recommend everyone to go to sea life if visiting the London Eye üòç

Ok, this experience only takes 1-2 hours so not a full day out. Nice range of sealife and well designed. I would advise arriving at opening and booking in advance as it can get very busy. No onsite cafe but plenty nearby. Nice gift shop at the end. Average.

address: Riverside Building, County Hall, Westminster Bridge Rd, London SE1 7PB, United Kingdom
